channel.title: C++ Kernel32
channel.description:
OK HAI NIGRS
I've been trying to make a trainer in C++, it is coded fine n shit, no errors on compilation except one. It says undeclared identifier for "WriteProccesMemory". Now I know that you need Kernel32.dll/.lib for that, but I have no idea how to work with it.
I tried downloading a kernel32.dll from the internet, using a dll -> lib converter and that didn't work. Then tried doing that with my System32/Kernel32.dll. Still no cigar. Then I tried importing it straight from System32 but it still didnt fucking work :(
I have tried this in VC++6, VC++8, Dev-C++ and it has never worked. I even tried downloading the SDK but I couldn't get VC++8 to work with it.
Any one know about this? :P TYVM

item.title: C++ Kernel32
item.dc:creator: @KryptoN KryptoN_
item.description:
@KryptoN wrote:

Bahahahaha :), and people laugh at proper spelling :p.

Read full topic

item.title: C++ Kernel32
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“nade, post:5, topic:119792”]It’s not in Components/Controls, it’s in the paths tab. There will be headers and libraries. Goto the libraries and add the kernel32 library. Btw, if you installed VC++6 and the service pack for it. I know 100% you shouldn’t have to add any library to make WriteProcessMemory work. You probably spelled WriteProcessMemory wrong. It’s 2s and 1c.

Haha.[/quote]OMFG I AM A FHKING RETARD!! I’ve been trying to get it to work for WEEKS
…I’ll just climb under a rock now…

Read full topic

item.title: C++ Kernel32
item.dc:creator: @nade nade
item.description:
@nade wrote:

It’s not in Components/Controls, it’s in the paths tab. There will be headers and libraries. Goto the libraries and add the kernel32 library. Btw, if you installed VC++6 and the service pack for it. I know 100% you shouldn’t have to add any library to make WriteProcessMemory work. You probably spelled WriteProcessMemory wrong. It’s 2s and 1c.

Haha.

Read full topic

item.title: C++ Kernel32
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“nade, post:2, topic:119792”]#pragma comment(lib, “wsock32”) //except for whatever you need?[/quote]tried that, didn’t work though >.>

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:3, topic:119792”]Find the .def module that the compiler makes, and then put under “IMPORTS”

_WriteProcessMemory@20 = kernel32.WriteProcessMemory [/quote]I can’t find a .def file anywhere in the project :[

[quote=“capndurk, post:1, topic:119794”]you have to include windows.h and link to kernel32.lib. to do that in dev-c++ you just do Project->Project Options->Parameters tab->Add Library or Object

go into your lib folder and choose libkernel32.a

although if you choose a windows project (or console) it should automatically link that and user32 and some others into your project for you, and msvc should do the same… you must be choosing empty project or something, don’t do that[/quote]I tried doing that in VC++6, I found a Components/Controls import option and looked around for Kernel32 but couldn’t find it :[

All help is appreciated!

Read full topic

item.title: C++ Kernel32
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Find the .def module that the compiler makes, and then put under “IMPORTS”

_WriteProcessMemory@20 = kernel32.WriteProcessMemory

Read full topic

item.description:
@nade wrote:

#pragma comment(lib, “wsock32”) //except for whatever you need?

I’ve been trying to make a trainer in C++, it is coded fine n shit, no errors on compilation except one. It says undeclared identifier for “WriteProccesMemory”. Now I know that you need Kernel32.dll/.lib for that, but I have no idea how to work with it.
